website_summaries.verdict: Wireless headphones that feature sound quality that is good enough for listening to music in addition to making phone calls.
pros: The battery fully charges in 2.5 hours and lasts up to 15 hours
Features active noise cancellation to minimize outside noise while making calls
Included USB adapter allows the headphones to connect wirelessly to your computer with a range of up to 100'
cons: It can be hard to hear yourself talk when on a call due to the noise cancellation
The wireless range to your computer can often be much less than 100 feet

customer_reviews.title: The best I've ever owned...
customer_reviews.text: I spend 11 hour days on the phone. I charge it at night, and it goes all day while I talk to my clients. Noise cancellation couldn't be better. I have an in office, widow air conditioner. Its noisy, but with the touch of a single button, 90% of the noise disappears. SOund and amplification is top-notch. Buttons are intuitive and can be operated with a simple touch. I can answer, and disconnect from my phone with a simple touch. It also talks to me. Lifting the microphone arm, tells me muted. Lowering it, says call connected, and it even gives a verbal readout of hours remaining on the battery. Impressive!!!!! Wish I'd found these years earlier.
customer_reviews.author: RBrown

customer_reviews.title: Working from a loud coffeeshop
customer_reviews.text: I saw a guy doing a conference call in the middle of a loud coffeeshop as I kept leaving to take calls and not have too much background noise. As soon as he put the headset down, I asked him how that was possible - and then immediately bought the Jabra Evolve 75 headset. You feel a bit like a telemarketer from 1988, but they are really effective at cancelling out background noise for calls. I've searched for something like this for years and am very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C Maggiano

customer_reviews.title: Impressive mic for open office
customer_reviews.text: I have video calls all day from an open office environment. The general chatter in the background wasn't a big issue, but when my coworker next to me was on the phone at the same time, others on my calls would hear her come through loud and clear. With the Jabra Evolve 75, it's impossible to tell that anyone other than me is talking at all. I even tested at home by leaving a voicemail with my partner talking loudly about 3 feet from the microphone, and my voice was the only part that was picked up on the recording. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Amazing noise-cancelling feature
customer_reviews.text: Amazing noise-cancelling headset! I often work out of home. My wife is a serious classical pianist who practices in the room right next to the study. When I need to do a phone call with business partners, these headsets get the job done. With the noise-cancellation technology in these headsets, my partners have no idea at all there is a ton of music being played near me. We hear each other crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: cander

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied so far
customer_reviews.text: The headphones arrived intact, complete, and a day earlier than promised. They replace a pair of VOYAGER FOCUS UCs I purchased in March. I was satisfied with the Voyager but within a month the cheap plastic broke and I got tired of gluing and taping them back together. The Jabras are more expensive but appear to have a higher build quality—time will tell. They are lighter and more comfortable and the sound quality is excellent. They came fully charged and I can say I’ve never purchased a device or piece of technology that was easier to set up—it took less than a minute to set up my computer and iPhone. So far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Harry C.

customer_reviews.title: Cut's Out on Mac Often
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality of these headphones, love the sound quality, and noise cancellation is as to be expected. When connected to my iPhone, the sound quality is awesome and functions great. When connected to my iMac, I have to be within about 2 ft of the Link 370 dongle otherwise it starts to cut out and stutter. It's really annoying. I'd give it fewer stars for that alone. The sound quality sometimes was sub-par when on the Mac as well, but a recent firmware update seemed to fix that issue, but the distance from my mac is sad. If I turn my head to look at my second my monitor if often stutters. :(
customer_reviews.author: Scott William

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching online
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for 2 months exactly. The have worked amazingly, better than my ear buds (Powerbeats) which don't always stay connected via Bluetooth. I like the USB connection for these, which gives me a stable connection. Works perfectly with Zoom and Skype. I can hear others, and they can hear me, perfectly. The only issue is that the battery runs down overnight, even when they had hours left on them and they were turned off, so best to always keep them plugged in. I woke up one morning to teach from them and they had no battery despite having only used them for a couple of hours the previous day and 12 hours left (so it said).
customer_reviews.author: RosesAreRed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with a caveat.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. -1 start because it often gets confused with 2 devices connected to it. Otherwise excellent product. The hear through feature is great for when not on calls. Can keep headset on and not feel isolated from environment.
customer_reviews.author: TomAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great noise cancellation, uncomfortable for long term wear
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation is quite remarkable. My complaints might be minor for some. It only works about 100 feet or so from the bluetooth source, which some non-bluetooth headsets exceed. And the cups are too small which might be obvious from the picture. Basically they sit on top of your ears not around them like some larger cans. As a result, at least for me, they get painful over time so aren't something you can wear all day. So for some people they'll be great. Others not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Connery

customer_reviews.title: Great features, less than ideal battery life
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this headset has some great features, fits comfortably, and offers great sound quality for listener and person you are speaking with. The downside is the battery life, especially if you use the active noise cancelling feature (a nice feature). The battery seems to drain quickly enough that a full battery charge does not last for the 8 hours per day I use it during work, so I tend to avoid using it too much although I want to. If you intend to use the headset for this long each day, you will need to charge it each day to avoid having to plug it in again during your work day.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bolger

customer_reviews.title: My ear canal & external ear hurts. I have tenderness on my ears.
customer_reviews.text: My ear canal and external ear hurts and sometimes my ears feel plugged. I also have great deal on tenderness, especially my right side. I started to feel ringing in my ears. I bought these headsets for work but my ears started to feel pain. I was using the headsets and lost hearing in the ear. This let me to evaluated by a ENT doctor and got a hearing tested and they didn’t find any abnormality. These problems started when I started using this headphones.
customer_reviews.author: luchia

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones -- Comfortable and Clear Listening and Speaking
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a set of Plantronics headphones because the mic boom had to be in an exact position for a clear pickup or it didn't work. Frustrating! These Jabra headphones are comfortable and the microphone pick up works fine. It's clear and the noise blocking is incredible. The Bluetooth connection is immediate and works every time. I love 'em. My only difficulty, and it's a small one, is the charging stand. Placing the headphones back on the stand to charge is not simple. But maybe I'll find a trick to may it easier...
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons of Jabra Evolve 75
customer_reviews.text: Please note: All comments are regarding a brand new item Pros: Good audio quality, mic seems good Cons: I got a notice this morning that it as a "4 hour battery remaining" .. lasted only 30 mins The unit's buttons do not match what the documentation describes. Music controls only work using bluetooth, and the mute and unmute controls for meetings only work with the dongle The dongle is REQUIRED for use for calls. While it works over bluetooth, most of the functions only work using the dongle Way overpriced. 50$ would be more appropriate The base station is ridiculously overpriced, its just a piece of plastic Hurts your ears after long days of being on the phone
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery
customer_reviews.text: Great headset, mic and noise cancelling work great for me. The battery is ridiculous. Sometimes it charges. Sometimes it shows a green light like its fully charged, but has zero battery life. Very VERY inconsistent. Basically have to be tethered by the power chord now which is cumbersome to say the least. Not at all worth the price. Looking at other reviews now I see why all the negative ratings mention something about the power capabilities. My advice, keep searching for a different headset.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan kuntz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product. Makes prospecting calls easier!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use. Sound quality both on my end and on the other persons end is good. I love that they are wireless as I like to wander when I chat on the phone. Range is also quite good. The only thing that takes a bit of getting used to is when I wear the headset I have trouble hearing myself talk with the noise cancelling. So I often wear the headset with the left ear uncovered so I can hear myself.
customer_reviews.author: Mark George

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality and battery life are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying these (got to expense them for work) for all of the Teams meetings that I've been on over the past few months. The audio quality is amazing (both listening and speaking) and the active noise cancelation really works well to block out background noise. They are very expensive... and I wouldn't have bought them if I hadn't been able to expense them, but I can definitely see why they cost so much. They're the best sounding headphones I have... and I have a TON of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: TechTestimony

customer_reviews.title: 14 Hour battery life after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I use my headset in a telesales environment 5 days a week, and on my commute to and from work. My workplace only provides inexpensive wired headsets, and my Jabra allows me to sound better to my clients while not being tethered. I love how I can walk all over the office without losing the signal. I can't sing praises about the music quality, it leaves something to be desired. But if your goal is to hear others, and be heard this is a great investment! With the noise cancellation on the microphone and headphones, I sound as if I am in a private office.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for open office
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely best! A real lifesaver in a noisy open office space. There’re better solutions for purely music (like Bose SC3), but for combined performance (meetings + music) this is by far the best. Usability is amazing. Everything is one-click. All functions present for even a demanding meetings-dweller. This is just a dream comes true after struggling through a bunch of Plantronics and other headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Stukalenko

customer_reviews.title: 4 months and bluetooth still won't connect
customer_reviews.text: I've tried for 4 months to get this thing to work. It's incredibly unitiutive and I had to buy an adapter to get it to connect via cord. At $200 I'd expect the bluetooth to not only work, but flawlessly and without requiring adapter (for first use to get bluetooth connected) I'm so incredibly frustrated with this purchase. I went beyond my 30 days to return just so I could try and figure it out. 4 months and it works even less than day 1. I can't even get it to work with the cord connected now. What a huge waste. Stay far away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Cheline

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Range
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to like these headphones. The build quality feels great and they were very comfortable. However, within 20 feet, the signal already started to degrade, drop out, and turn robotic. I tried pairing them directly with my Mac first, so I thought maybe it was because I wasn't using the included transceiver. When I tried with the Jabra bluetooth transceiver, it was even worse. If you just need these from within a few feet of your desk or you work in an open field with no walls, then these might be great headphones. Otherwise, I'd stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't actually connect with it's own USB transceiver
customer_reviews.text: It should just work. Plug in the USB transceiver, turn on the headset, choose the correct windows sound device, and it should just work. Several hours later, it pairs fine with any other Bluetooth phone or laptop, but won't work with it's own USB transceiver. Super frustrated by what should e a no brainer to setup. Customer support is email only, and they don't answer. Totally not worth the price, do not recommend. Went to Best Buy and bought the Bose. Works like a champ, took 10 min to un-box and pair.
customer_reviews.author: John Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around headset for business and music listening purposes
customer_reviews.text: Using this for one week and I am very impressed. The quality is excellent from a comfort and design standpoint. The sound quality is way better than my old Logitech USB headset and my clients report that the sound quality of my voice is clear. Battery life is 14 hours and every time you power up the headset, you will get a verbal alert for battery life remaining (perfect design feature). The only critique is the user manual is a booklet with only 3-4 pages in English that provide little detail on the subtle features of the device. I will have to explore YouTube for a primer. Otherwise, I am very very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bilkovski

customer_reviews.title: Microphone Quality Degrades Often
customer_reviews.text: I've had several wireless headsets over the years and this has been the most expensive but the least reliable for talking to other people with. The other people in the call report that my voice degrades randomly even though I'm close to the computer AND on a reliable connection in a quiet room. I've updated the firmware and have no other issues with other headsets. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jared B

customer_reviews.title: The bluetooth pairing switch no longer works.  Takes 8 hours to charge
customer_reviews.text: Initially my response was good but they tend to fall off if you move your head too much. But after using them for awhile I find it no longer connects with my phone when I turn them on. Trying to repair them I find that the bluetooth pairing button no longer works. The headset completely ignores the switch no matter how long I hold it in the pairing position. It also takes overnight (at least 8 hours) to charge. All in all a very disappointing experience for what should at this price point be a premium headset.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth Headset
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Bluetooth headset that i have found. The sound quality is very impressive and sounds like bose quality to me. The headset is very sturdy and yet soft to wear. I wear mine sometimes all day and my ears are not sore. On cold days it fits over my stocking hat and I can hear great. The mic is great and fold up out of your way when not using it. The bluetooth range is very good and the noise cancelling is great. I run heavy equipment and you cant' even hear the motors running when your on the phone. Great product and amazing battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Glasco

customer_reviews.title: Bad audio, bad range,
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing, even ran all firmware updates link 370 and headset. Range is less than half what if should be. Audio is garbled sitting next to computer. Often i miss chat notifications because the audio is so delayed that the sound stopped playing before the headset could even turn the audio on. Miserable product used with Teams and Skype. Bluetooth worked better with PC than the link 370. Just noticed that every 20 seconds there is a knock noise that the headset is producing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, works well with Skype for Business and Teams
customer_reviews.text: I needed something with a better microphone for conference calls and this headset delivers. It works via USB or bluetooth (dongle included if needed), and has no issues paired to both my laptop and my phone. Noise cancellation on the MIC is great, for the headphones it is just ok. It works well to muffle office sounds, but these are not comparable to Bose or Sony NC headphones, in my experience. They are on-ear, so you are limited in the performance. I have had no comfort issues with the headset yet.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality...but too much noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.text: These definitely did the job of noise cancelling. I ended up needing to return them because when I spoke it sounded like my voice was so loud in my head. If you hold your hands over your ears and speak, that’s what it sounds like with these headphones on. Everyone on the other end of the phone said my voice sounded clear. I could hear everyone clearly. But i just couldn’t get used to the sound of my voice in my head.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Love them. Could be a tad more comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: PROS The sound is awesome and the wireless distance is great. Very stable connected to my PC. pushing the microphone up to mute works well. Customer service is awesome. They are pretty comfortable but not the MOST comfortable headphones I have worn (and yet the most expensive). Even cheap Mpows are more comfortable. So I'll give it 5 stars because everyone's head and ears are different. Comfort may be subjective.
customer_reviews.author: KCM

customer_reviews.title: I looked around for a while for a good headset. My business partner and I often sit ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked around for a while for a good headset. My business partner and I often sit in the same room, and one of us would have to leave the room when the other had a call. The in-ear noise cancellation on these things are ok, but the noise cancellation on the microphone is excellent. Nothing worse than background noise being audible to the far end of a business call. Only downside is that I wish it had DECT transmission for more range, instead of bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Mata

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Headset for Calls
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use these to a great extent, so take this with a grain of salt. I love the battery life and comfortability of this headset, especially for the price. Your audio quality both input and output are great. My only precaution, don't buy these for their music quality. They weren't made for that so it's not a problem, but if you're looking for a set that music sounds incredible in, it's not these. I'm a bit of a music snob, though, so obviously if you just want some background music these will do great.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: Can’t have best of both world.
customer_reviews.text: These work fine. The active noise canceling features are well below the industry standard but the mic and phone features are much higher than other noise canceling headphones. These will not come close to comparing in either sound quality or noise canceling to actual headphones. And vice versa one cannot regularly use noise canceling headphones as a headset.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy Jeff

customer_reviews.title: sound over bluetooth is garbled, unusable for conference calls
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Noise cancellation works well, comfortable to wear, good battery life Cons: Headsets are advertised as bluetooth but when connecting to laptop over BT sound quality is poor, garbled and cuts in and out. The only way to make it work reliably is either plugging it into the laptop or by using the supplied dongle. I explicitly bought a BT headset so I wouldn't need a dongle because my laptop only has two USB-C ports and having a dongle plus adapter plugged in is a pain and they often break off/get lost. Returning item
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I gave my wife my 65 and bought this one for myself. I need the boom mic due to work. The noise cancellation works great when I’m actively listening to something, otherwise it does not cancel background noise. The Bluetooth range is much farther than the 65. My chief complaint is that my iPhone will not automatically default to the headset when connected.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Link 370 USB Adapter failed
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi USB dongle (Link 370 USB Adapter) came apart after 4 1/2 months of use. The firmware updates had improved some of the issues other have noted in their reviews. Honestly, this has been a good and reliable device with battery power that lasts a full day of meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: It's impressive, but it better be for this price
customer_reviews.text: I truly love these things, and i never would have bought them if my company wouldn't had paid for them. There are several coffee shops i would never work in because people on the other end heard way too much background noise on the phone. But these things are awesome for working in public spaces, or even just at home with kids around screaming. Love them, they work as you'd expect a $200+ pair of headphones to work.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, easy to use. Perfect for WFH!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the beginning of the lockdown and it has served me well. Its very easy to use and has made work from home much more bearable. I have been using it every day for 8 hours. The battery will last the whole day, but will drain very quickly if noise cancellation is on. Overall sound quality is very good; noise cancellation is just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: excellent in most respects
customer_reviews.text: Good: sound quality, range, battery life, noise cancellation, auto-muting when you swing up the boom Less good: they make my ears sweat and there’s a lag when you start up sound after a period of silence. This is presumably due to battery-saving technologies but I would rather have batteries that die quicker and no lag. I got the stand because I thought it was required. It’s not; you can skip it and plug in an micro-USB cable to charge the headset.
customer_reviews.author: Neurasthenic

customer_reviews.title: Did not last...
customer_reviews.text: These worked great, up until about a month ago when the battery would not charge properly. It would either only work if plugged in, or charge would not last very long. Now, the lights come on if plugged in but headset will not work. Of course, I'm right outside of the 12 month warranty. It's amazing that the price has gone up $100 since I purchased February 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia D Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them for a while now. The microphone is very good even in noisy environments. Our office is open seating and most people need to participate in conference calls from their desks. The headset is great for quality of audio production and the mic limits environmental noise. The headphones also came with Restworks cellphone application to provide "Focus at Work" sounds. I thought the software was stupid until I tried it. For me, the audio track actually works. I am able to concentrate on my work irrespective of the conversations going on all around. Really appreciate the application. Great battery life. 14 Hours fully charged. The headphones tell you the expected remainder of battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Headset slides on smoothly and charges well.
customer_reviews.text: This phone stand works on our Jabra headset that uses the micro USB charger. The headset slides on like butter and is held on the stand well. I was skeptical of the design causing the port to wear out, but now that I’ve used it they designed it to prevent wear. You don’t have to force the headset on the stand at all.
customer_reviews.author: Debounce

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, but pricy
customer_reviews.text: Needed an everyday headset for work and these are excellent. Hated paying so much, but with care they should last for years. Update....lost the first unit on a plane 2 years after buying. Checked options whe American Airlines could find them in my seat back,,,,gurrr.... Still joting better for day in and out use. 2nd pair is never traveling with me. Cheep unit bought was awful. Work offers the 65 model and I that using that too. Just bought another 75 ms and loving it from day one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, light-weight, and love being able to mute by flipping up the mic
customer_reviews.text: These are light-weight and comfortable. I’m told the sound quality is amazing by others in meetings on Zoom and Teams. Being able to mute yourself just by flipping up the mic is awesome, I use that constantly. Very happy. Not cheap, so hard to say if it is worth the price, but I use it daily and am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Definitely better than just okay, but maybe not great
customer_reviews.text: Updating my review, giving more than one star. this headset DID arrive with its USB dongle... After a few days use Think it’s a better than just okay, but not great, headset. Being able to connect to both my phone and laptop wirelessly is a really nice bonus, and the headset is comfortable. The range isn’t exactly ~100ft, the sound starts to crackle at about 20-30 ft. If it was less expensive, I’d overlook it and give this headset 4 stars. Overall, I don’t regret the purchase. However I’m wondering if I would’ve picked a different headset had I done more comparative shopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hurts ears / head after several hours use
customer_reviews.text: I like these. The quality is fine. I only use them for work phone calls. The only complaint I have is that I feel pressure and dull pain around my ears (perhaps on the veins around it?) on days where I use them for several hours in a row. I have a small head. I don't know if this is specific to how I wear them or not. I considered returning, but the truth is I don't have many days where I use them for that long amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Stream

customer_reviews.title: High latency (delay), stutter, robotic voice
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, it does have some pros, but the cons easily beat the pros. The high latency and stuttering/robotic sound counters all the good things this device provides. This is year 2020, and I wouldn't expect a high-end headset to experience these fundamental issues that even cheap, no-brand products don't have. Overall, I wish I returned it. Pros - Comfortable fit (even with glasses) - Good sound quality (when the connection is stable) - Easy mute (just slide the mic to the top and it gets muted) - Long battery (lasts all day long) Cons - High latency (when you watch YouTube, audio is a few seconds late) - Stuttering, robotic sound
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat expensive but good addition to home office
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy switch between phone and laptop and the cool mute function helps me concentrate and switch to conversations in the house. The battery life is long enough for me to take conference calls and web meetings all day. They also seems to do a good job of filtering out the dogs as they enforce social distancing with anyone foolish enough to come anywhere near our house. Only complaint is the range. I can walk virtually the entire house with my other Bluetooth headphones. These lose connection within a few feet of my home office door.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This headset is expensive, but I haven't had one issue with it while walking around my home office. I've even gone downstairs to the garage below my office and it has stayed connected. There's probably a cheaper option out there, but I'm really happy with the purchase from a quality standpoint.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best headset I’ve ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This headset is incredible. Once you put it on you cannot even hear any sound at all in the room. I had a fan going put on the headphones and I could not even hear the fan. Did a test call in Microsoft Teams in the quality was absolutely amazing. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and overall useability
customer_reviews.text: The issue is with Mac products. The solution you have with the USB dongle does not work. Jabra should have paid for the certification and use the native Bluetooth on the Mac. I do not recommend purchasing if you are a Mac user because of the issues with their USB to the Mac interface. Perfect on Windows machines and iPhone/ android.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Marrazzo

customer_reviews.title: Save your $$$
customer_reviews.text: Worst battery life. They can charge all night and as soon as I put them on, I’m already getting “Battery Low” messages. Loved connecting to 2 devices, but I stopped connecting to my cellphone to try and saved battery life. Didn’t make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Sounds and battery are great, but what does that matter if it never works. The bluetooth constantly drops. Does not transfer smoothly between Zoom, Chime, and BT on the phone. Often need to forget BT device on phone and setup again. Now, the headset will not allow me to sync to bluetooth. If you hold the button down, the BT sync light never comes on. This happened before and I upgraded the software and it worked. Once again it is not working and there is no software update. For a headset that costs $200, now $329 because of Covid-19 this is absolutely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity/Sound quality issues
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is awesome unless it is simultaneously connected to two devices and you happen to forget that it was and you joined a conference call. Then the sound quality is robotic. Hard to hear and put up with. In that situation, you will have to un-join the conference call, unconnect/forget the other device and re-join the conference call. Then the sound quality will be back to normal. The sound quality is the same for both GoToMeeting, Microsoft Teams...etc. desktop app and web browser version. Also, this product states that you have a range up to 100ft/30m. This not the case. Audio quality breaks down less than 10 feet away. Other than that the product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Teklai

customer_reviews.title: just return
customer_reviews.text: The headset is really nice looking and good quality, I thought they would wok good for my meetings, since now we should work on line. We are using Teams and WebEx, I can hear that voice quality is really good, but people cannot hear my voice clearly. My internet speed is 300 mbps, so I assume should not be a connection issues. I have no issues with my apple air pods, so I returned this device.
customer_reviews.author: Yelana

customer_reviews.title: best headphones i've owned
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and live in an apartment. Sometimes the laundry and dishwasher are going and people hear nothing. Also took this out to a restaurant and I took a conference call. The people on the line heard nothing regardless of how loud the restaurant was. These are the best noise cancelling headphones I've owned. Also have beats and bose and these are better than both.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought a $50 BT headset and it wasn't compatible with my laptop and MS Teams. Worked with their support and couldn't resolve it. Returned them and bought these. Really a beautiful product. Great sound quality. Pairs easily with both PC (with a dongle) and my phone (no dongle). Nice features including active noise cancellation (amazing!), "listen in" button that mics in the surrounding sounds, mute button. The on-headset controls don't control Pandora, but works fine with my phone. It will bring up my Jabber phone app on my laptop, need to figure out how to get it work with MS Teams.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Working from home with conference calls and multiple kids was a challenge! Not anymore with these headsets; my kids can play and I can hear my calls because these headsets block my kid's thumps and bumps while clarifying my phone calls. Best money I've spent in a long while!
customer_reviews.author: Cottage Creek

customer_reviews.title: Jabra delivers on an excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: These are expensive, but so far have lived up to my expectations. I have been a WFH employee for years and these are by far the best wireless headphones for the job. My coworkers tell me the sound quality is outstanding when on WebEx, Zoom, and Teams. Love the auto mute function that it tied in with the microphone (raise to mute, lower to unmute)...works seamlessly with the services listed above. Incoming sound quality is amazing and the noise cancellation is very good. I would definitely buy again or even buy as a gift to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: The ANC gave me a headache
customer_reviews.text: It was on the heavy side and felt unnatural uncomfortable to me. With active noise cancellation on, I did notice the difference with white noise reduction, but it gave me a headache within minutes. I could also hear the conversation around me, which sounded distant but clearly audible. So not really helpful. I will stick with my Evolve 40.
customer_reviews.author: garunner

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love them for home office use. I wish they had a full over eat wireless version to make them more comfortable. Great once you install the 360 software. Connects to both my pc and mobile phone with seamless transfers.
customer_reviews.author: dannyp

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly terrible
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a stan for Jabra headsets. I've had a Jabra Pro Duo on my desk for as long as I can remember. I've purchased countless Evolve 40s and 65s for coworkers users and friends. But the Evolve 75 might have the worst call quality I've ever experienced. It sounds static-y. On the other end, reported I sounded loud and muffled at the same time. Having a dock might help with battery life but not having the Jabra Link built in is a huge mistake. I'm not going to sacrifice 2 USB ports. Noise cancellation was FINE at best. found it better on both the Logitech and Plantronics headsets.
customer_reviews.author: marcymarc

customer_reviews.title: Hideously buggy
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of whether the headset is off or on, it seems to be about 50-50 whether calls try to play sound through the builtin speakers or headset. Firmware update installs fail with "no devices in firmware update mode found". Jabra Direct updates fail for some inscrutable reason. Stay away, at least if you're on macOS. I can't imagine how they managed to screw up what should be simple software this badly.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Easy to setup and use. I haven’t had any issues and use with MS teams, Skype, Webex, Zoom and listening to music and videos. Also connect to my phone. Great being able to switch between laptop and phone seamlessly. Never had any connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great headset with all the desired features
customer_reviews.text: This headset had all the features I was looking for, one of the few that did. Noise cancelling, boom mic, over the ear style, reasonable price, and most importantly, a mute button. I can move to another floor of the house from my office, or outside, and both the mic output and reception are still great. You can sync to your laptop and your mobile phone and switch between the two on the fly. The charging stand takes up some desk space, but not that big a deal. Only reason it wasn't a 5 out of 5 is that my Bose are more comfortable, but that is more a personal preference than anything.
customer_reviews.author: J Bonfeld

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have used a headset at work for at least 15 years. At a new job, I was given this pair by my company. This headset is so much better than every other phone headset I have ever used that I think that every competitor they have should be embarrassed.
customer_reviews.author: NC Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and convenient. works well for remote operations so that I am not tied to the PC when on a Skype or WebEx call. The audio is clear and chartime is decent, charge hold time is better than expected. The only genuine gripe I do have is the “On, Mid & Off” positions are not clearly legible since the markings and material are in the same color, so you have to remember where they are on either side of the Middle, otherwise I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound, terrible connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, I don’t know if their is any noise cancellation at all, but have nothing to compare it to and terrible Bluetooth connectivity. Once you figure it out though you can deal with it. You have to link, unlink and then delink again. Once you do this every time when you connect again you’re good. The microphone works great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great For Data Center Workers
customer_reviews.text: I work in Different Data Center Environments. I am able to communicate with my coworkers without them knowing i'm in the DC's with this headset. Its not going to be a replacement for hearing protection as its not over ear so i wouldn't recommend to replace a good pair of Hearing Protection Headphones but works great for Noisy environment Communications.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Owen

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth basically died
customer_reviews.text: For the two weeks they worked properly the 75s were the perfect headset - connected simultaneously to iPhone and PC, great sound, great NC. Then stopped connecting to phone altogether. Was on phone with Jabra tech support for an hour upgrading firmware, which fixed the problem for about 10 minutes. Now iPhone might as well not exist and red "busy" lights won't go off. Guess I'll have to find a more established brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth only works with the included dongle
customer_reviews.text: This is really dumb, but Jabra has designed the headset in such a way that it does not work with the built-in bluetooth capability of a MacBook. This means you have to use the tiny USB-A dongle for a device that only has USB-C ports.
customer_reviews.author: B. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I use these for working at home. The charge lasts a long time. Noise cancelling works great. I love that it goes in and out of mute by just moving the microphone up or down - very intuitive.The light on the side that says I am on a call is very useful when my family is around. I also used them for a couple of long flights and found them comfortable and provided good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: AK99501

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this headset
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this headset! The noise cancelling microphone works amazingly! I work from a home office without a door. During the summer, I have my teenage girls and two Yorkshire Terriers making all kinds of noise. It was pretty embarrassing when I was on conference calls or web meetings as I constantly had to mute the barking dogs or loud teenagers. Once I got this headset, multiple colleagues asked if I had rented an office as they couldn't hear anything. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Andre P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones. Comfortable and everything works just as described. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The other side can't hear me
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this headset. I have consistently problems with it, the other side can't hear me. They tell me I'm breaking off.That is the only issue I have, but I use it as a business phone and for that reason it is really bad. I use it with Vonage and Skype. Experiences are bad with both.
customer_reviews.author: barbara greenhill

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I use these head phones for my work phone with Microsoft Teams. The sound is great and the noise cancellation works really well as I generally work from a home office. After a full charge, I can usually get 2 or 3 days of my typical usage before I have to recharge them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: awesome headset
customer_reviews.text: great headset, the only two negatives: ears start to sweat after some usage as the material is not breathable, and its Bluetooth, so distance limitation, otherwise it lasts all day long, perfect voice quality etc etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dariusz K.

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of communications headsets and these beat um all. Sound quality, noise cancellation (with options), and battery life are second to none. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Keith O

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, spend your money somewhere else.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is great, lasts two full work days. Everything else is garbage. The noise cancelling doesn't cancel noise, the microphone picks up everything but my voice, and phone calls sound like garbled robotic garbage. You'd think for $300 the headphones would at least be comfortable, but they aren't even that. Skip these, spend your money on something else. Anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Trace Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Skype and my international calls
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to hook up to my laptop! I use Skype though my computer and my staff from other Countries commented that my voice was extremely clear. I can walk to my mailbox across the street which faces my office window and I can hear my calls very well during my daily visit to the mailbox (1wall away from laptop. I have a lot of walls in the house so I can’t get full range of the house when walking and speaking but at least I can hear majority of the calls with some crackling when I move downstairs into kitchen area (3 walls away from laptop)
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for meetings
customer_reviews.text: I have another set of noise cancelling headphones I use for music and now I have this, that I use for meetings. It’s awesome. The mic and sound are great over Bluetooth or plugged in. Battery life is insanely good.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Merriman

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best all-around headset for the digital age
customer_reviews.text: Connects to computer with 200 feet of mobility and clear sound, and connects simultaneously (bluetooth) to the cell phone, allows you to manage both calls. Made for working, but excellent sound quality for music and just listening. These people know how to do noise cancellation and the headset is comfortable enough for a coast-to-coast flight with maximum stress reduction.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Works very well but gets uncomfortable very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Love that it connects to my laptop and phone at the same time. If a call comes in then music pauses. Only complaints: 1) It is tight over the ears and tends to get uncomfortable very quickly (20min). 2) Also the announcement every time it connects takes a few seconds to tell you it is connected, and the battery life, which sometimes is annoying if I'm trying to answer a call.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with these
customer_reviews.text: Had these headphones for 2 weeks now. Sound quality is good. The bluetooth syncing is really easy. Connects to both my cell phone and soft phone on my laptop everytime with no issues. Battery life is great. The only thing preventing 5 stars is the headphones do tend to slip around on my head when walking around my house. I could see that being a problem if used while walking outside
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST QUALITY NOICE CANCELING - ONE HEADSET FOR TELECONFERENCES AND MUSIC
customer_reviews.text: Well, i hated the price but if you want something that works perfect this is it. This Headset is PERFECT. I already forgot about the price. Every teleconference perfect. Love the mute function by lifting the mike. Connection with Bluetooth and 370 perfect. Thank You Jabra for the product that is perfect. Other headsets like Logitech H800 not even close - simply Jabra is comfortable, sound quality amazing and Bluetooth always works even at extreme ranges.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Krasucki

customer_reviews.title: Great web conferencing headset.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sound and battery life. Have had them for a couple of months and they are working great.
customer_reviews.author: textJason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for open office environment.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for open office environment. Noise cancellation best for repeating sounds but only lowers voices. Cas is too thick...does not fit well in brief case. These are the ones optimized for Skype and does that flawlessly. I like the way mic mutes when you swing it up into stored position.
customer_reviews.author: TBSportPix

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t live up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this product did not live up to the promises. All sorts of issues getting it connected to my Mac. Lots of practice with many Zoom calls and had sound issues 9 times out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Pigglet222

customer_reviews.title: Jabra Headset
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it has a great noise cancelling feature. It feels soft on your ears and has a good mike. It is a hands free . Good quality. Just make sure you get one that is not too tight around your head.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: It's not comfortable, nor sounds great. It does have a good mic but for what I paid, not sure it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: L Almighty

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! I have tested this with loud noises in the background and NOT a tiny amount of background could be heard by the caller in the other end. The noise canceling is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: CC Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Could not imagibe going back to no headphones! I WFH, and am on a lot of conference calls...and I have 7 dogs! We've all been on "those" calls, where someone's dog is always barking in the background. Not a big deal unless you have as many dogs as I do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fidelity!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product! It has fantastic fidelity, easy to operate and quality parts. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pilot, hunter and fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Good product but it’s not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great but this product can use some more work on design. It’s uncomfortable if wears for extended amount of time
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good when it is connected
customer_reviews.text: continually disconnect from my phone. I have to keep turning headset on and off to re-sync. missed my return window so will put up with it
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Initially I did not like the idea of not having a head set that would not cover my ears completely and boy was i wrong. This headset has motivated me to make more and more calls. I called my front desk, to ask how was my voice was sounding and her response was as normal which is what i wanted to hear since i always use my with your handset as the quality is great and now with this headset it sounds the same way or better. I have not had anybody ask me what did you say, which was the case with my old headset. Loving it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: What a great headset. I love that as a low spoken person, people can clearly hear me with these. They just work like a good headset should. They paired with computer and cell phone easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya murray

customer_reviews.title: Best productivity device I have purchased!
customer_reviews.text: This headset is amazing! Pairs with 2 devices - so my Cisco office phone and my iPhone. Love that when you swing the microphone up, it auto mutes! Great is you live on phone calls and webEx meetings!
customer_reviews.author: JW2012

customer_reviews.title: Best headset I've owned
customer_reviews.text: this is by far the nicest headset I've ever owned. Sound quality is great, connection is strong, and they are comfortable for all day use
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Harper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, especially for MS Teams.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent audio quality. Loud and clear on both ends. Active noise cancellation not so great but overall performance and good volume range compensates for this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I doubt if it's as good as others out there
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if my unit was faulty but had a bad experience with this device, wish I coins try again...
customer_reviews.author: Nagen Swamy

product_meta.title: Jabra Evolve 75 UC Stereo Wireless Bluetooth Headset / Music Headphones Including Link 370 (U.S. Retail Packaging), Black
product_meta.description: Style:UC Optimized (Standard)The Evolve 75 is a wireless headset with superior Active noise cancellation and integrated busy light to enhance your productivity. Dual connectivity to two Bluetooth devices allows you to take calls and listen to music from the same headset, giving you extra freedom to move 100ft/30M away from your smartphone and/or PC.
feature_bullets: Outstanding sound for calls and music - World-class speakers and HD voice for crystal-clear calls and music
Microphone frequency range 150 hertz - 6.8 kilohertz. Reduce noise and interruptions - Superior ANC and integrated busy light acts as a ‘do not disturb’ sign to enhance productivity

Supported Bluetooth profiles: A2DP (v1.2), hands free (v1.6), Headset (v1.2), AGHFP (v1.6). Bluetooth wireless technology: Bluetooth 4.0. Dual Bluetooth connectivity for calls and music. Flexibility to move up to 100 feet/30 meter away from your connected device

Active noise cancellation uses advanced microphones to monitor and counter ambient noise. Talk-time- up to 15 hours. Battery time (with ANC activated) - Up to 30 hours. Charging time- Max. 120 minutes
Certified with all major communication platforms. Bluetooth: 4.2

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,101 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Jabra Link 370, Pouch, Jabra Evolve 75, Quick start guide, Warranty & Warning
